availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexius Joseph McAtee (Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Daviess County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Maryland native. Son of James McAtee and Elizabeth Elder McAtee. Married to Caroline Spaulding McAtee in 1835. Father of Mary McAtee, Ellen McAtee, Richard McAtee, Henrietta McAtee, Catherine McAtee, and Jane McAtee. Married to Sarah Ann Merryman McAtee in Nelson County, Kentucky, on April 1, 1850. Father of James McAtee. Married to Myra Windsor McAtee in Daviess County, Kentucky, on April 1, 1856. Father of Taylor McAtee. Married to Euphemia May McAtee. Father of Alexius H. McAtee and C. Bettie McAtee. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Enslaved nine people in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Daviess County in 1860. Enslaved eleven people in Daviess County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Daviess County in 1863.
